question: Which pharaoh united Upper and Lower Egypt?
description: Narmer, also known as Menes, is credited with uniting Upper and Lower Egypt around 3100 BC.

question: Which pharaoh built the Great Pyramid?
description: Khufu, also known as Cheops, was the pharaoh who commissioned the Great Pyramid of Giza, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.

question: Which pharaoh built the first pyramid?
description: Djoser, also known as Netjerikhet, was the pharaoh who commissioned the Step Pyramid at Saqqara, the first pyramid in Egypt.

question: Which pharaoh was the last to rule Egypt?
description: Cleopatra VII was the last active ruler of the Ptolemaic Kingdom of Egypt, known for her relationships with Julius Caesar and Mark Antony.

question: Which pharaoh was monotheistic?
description: Akhenaten, originally named Amenhotep IV, is known for abandoning traditional polytheism and introducing worship centered on the sun disk Aten.

question: Which pharaoh was a woman, but was depicted with a beard?
description: Hatshepsut description

question: Which pharaoh was the first to be buried in the Valley of the Kings?
description: Thutmose I was the first pharaoh to be buried in the Valley of the Kings, marking a shift in royal burial practices.

question: Which pharaoh is featured in the movie "The Mummy"?
description: Seti I is depicted in the movie "The Mummy" as the pharaoh whose tomb is disturbed by the main characters.

question: Which pharaoh is featured in the movie "The Prince of Egypt"?
description: Ramses II is depicted in the animated film "The Prince of Egypt" as the pharaoh during the time of Moses.

question: Which pharaoh is featured in the poem "Ozymandias"?
description: Ramses II is the subject of Percy Bysshe Shelley's poem "Ozymandias," which reflects on the impermanence of power and legacy.

question: Which god rules the underworld?
description: Osiris is the god of the afterlife and the underworld in ancient Egyptian mythology, often depicted as a mummified king.

question: Which god has the head of a falcon?
description: Horus description

question: Which god has the head of a jackal?
description: Anubis is the god of mummification and the afterlife, often depicted with the head of a jackal.

question: Which god is the sun god?
description: Ra is the ancient Egyptian sun god, often depicted with a falcon head and a sun disk.

question: Which god is the god of chaos?
description: Set is the god of chaos, storms, and the desert in ancient Egyptian mythology, often depicted as a creature with a curved snout.

question: Which god invented hieroglyphics?
description: Thoth is the god of writing, knowledge, and wisdom in ancient Egyptian mythology, often depicted with the head of an ibis.

question: Which goddess is asssociated with the cat?
description: Bastet description

question: Which goddess is the goddess of war?
description: Sekhmet is the goddess of war and healing in ancient Egyptian mythology.

question: Which goddess is the goddess of the sky?
description: Nut is the goddess of the sky and the heavens in ancient Egyptian mythology.

question: Which goddess is the goddess of motherhood?
description: Isis is the goddess of motherhood, magic, and fertility in ancient Egyptian mythology.

question: Who was the archaeologist who discovered King Tut's tomb?
description: Howard Carter discovered the tomb of Tutankhamun in 1922, which was one of the most significant archaeological finds in history.

question: Who was the first archaeologist to decipher hieroglyphics?
description: Jean-Fran√ßois Champollion was the first to decipher Egyptian hieroglyphs using the Rosetta Stone.

question: What are mummy wrappings made of?
description: Mummies were wrapped in linen bandages to preserve the body for the afterlife.

question: What would ancient Egyptians put in canopic jars?
description: Canopic jars were used to store and preserve the organs of the deceased for the afterlife.
